content.description: Sit start on obvious crimps under the right side of the wave ledge.   Get your feet on big, low shelf and then throw for the wave feature.   Work yourself up into a fun mantle, then reach up and over the top.  There are no distinct holds on the top, but, as you are standing on a giant ledge at this point, that's not a big deal.
content.protection: A pad.  The crux is a low mantle over a flat landing.
content.location: This problem starts under the right side of the wave ledge.

content.description: V1 start up jugs to get onto the arete to the right of The Wave. Traverse up and left, then make the crux drop down move into The Wave. Continue traversing left on the Wave feature and continue left to the V1 arete. You can either top out there or go all the way to the V0 slab as per the BB guide; either way I think it's the same grade
content.location: Sit on a tree stump and start with hands on jug flake to the right of The Wave

content.description: The reverse of the traverse. A little bit of an eliminate, but super cool movement. V4 start move, traverse the wave feature to the right, then do a muscle up to get into a mantle and get onto the sloper at the lip that you drop down from on The Wave Traverse. Use undercling flake to get feet up and top out. Super powerful!
content.location: Same sit start as Tsunami; left incut crimp, right sidepull block thingy

content.description: From BB: Sit down start and throw for the rail mantle and top out. Not sure the exact hands, but the most obvious for us was left incut crimp jug and right on a side pull block thingy. Same top out as The Wave
content.location: On the left face of the wave feature

content.description:
Stand start with you right hand on a side pull and your left fingers in a thin crack.  Pull left to a deep dish and traverse a bit on thin feet.  Top out straight over the dish.

The problem is slabby, so its pretty fun if you're into that.  One of the cracks near the top out is nice and deep, but feels like it'll catch you finger and rip it off if you fall; to be fair, that's probably just an irrational fear of mine.  I wasn't scared enough to not use it; it's pretty easy to not fall.
content.protection: Pad.  The landing is nice and flat and the problem doesn't get very high off the deck.
content.location: This problem starts on the arete to the left of the wave feature on the boulder.
